content: The **Singapore Police Force Gurkha Contingent Pipes and Drums Platoon** is a 35 strong platoon currently led by [Inspector](/wiki/Inspector) Bipin Yonjan. The Honorary Band President is [Superintendent](/wiki/Superintendent_(police)) Tony Bergin, who is the Deputy Commander of the [Gurkha Contingent](/wiki/Gurkha_Contingent). Formed in 1955 out of the Contingent's [Gurkha](/wiki/Gurkha) officers, it includes officers trained as [pipers](/wiki/Bagpipes), [drummers](/wiki/Drummer) and [buglers](/wiki/Bugler). The platoon performs regularly in partnership with the [Singapore Police Force Band](/wiki/Singapore_Police_Force_Band) and the Women Police Pipes and Drums in combined performances locally as well as abroad. It has participated in the 1991 [Edinburgh Military Tattoo](/wiki/Edinburgh_Military_Tattoo), the 2001 Adelaide International Police Tattoo, the 2002 Malaysian Police and Military Tattoo in [Kuala Lumpur](/wiki/Kuala_Lumpur) and the 2005 Musikschau der Nationen in [Bremen](/wiki/Bremen_(city)), [Germany](/wiki/Germany), in recent years either on its own or along with the other bands from the [Singapore Police Force](/wiki/Singapore_Police_Force). In June 2014, it performed "Happy Birthday" in honor of the [Queen's Official Birthday](/wiki/Queen%27s_Official_Birthday) in the [United Kingdom](/wiki/United_Kingdom). - [Band of the Brigade of Gurkhas](/wiki/Band_of_the_Brigade_of_Gurkhas) - [Deshon Ka Sartaj Bharat](/wiki/Deshon_Ka_Sartaj_Bharat) - [Military Music Wing](/wiki/Military_Music_Wing) - [Samman Guard](/wiki/Samman_Guard) - [Guard of honour](/wiki/Guard_of_honour) - [Band and Bugles of The Rifles](/wiki/Band_and_Bugles_of_The_Rifles) - Official site This Singapore-related article is a stub.
